text: To determine the mechanisms responsible for these differences , we turned to human U937 promonocytic cells .

U937 cells transfected with the human full-length <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter connected to a luciferase reporter gene were submitted to transcription assays , Northern blotting , and DNA electrophoresis mobility gel shift assays .

These studies revealed that Calphostin C inhibited the nuclear translocation of the transcription factor activator protein - 1 ( AP-1 ) which is considered necessary for <extra_id_0> FN <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induction of <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene transcription , and prevented the transcription of the <extra_id_0> IL-1beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene .
